title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that some government institutions might attract young people.

Two points for explaining a reason why some government institutions might attract young people.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following reasons why the location of public institutions may result in the particular age structure shown in the population pyramid:
The response correctly explains one of the following reasons why the location of public institutions may result in the particular age structure shown in the population pyramid:
The response correctly explains one of the following reasons why the location of public institutions may result in the particular age structure shown in the population pyramid:

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating a demographic pull factor.

Two points for stating a demographic pull factor and describing why this factor might motivate a female migrant from a rural area to move to an urban area in a very distant location.
descriptions: The response does not correctly describe one of the following demographic pull factors that would motivate a female migrant from a rural area to move to an urban area in a very distant location:
The response correctly describes one of the following demographic pull factors that would motivate a female migrant from a rural area to move to an urban area in a very distant location:
The response correctly describes one of the following demographic pull factors that would motivate a female migrant from a rural area to move to an urban area in a very distant location:

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that women have a longer life expectancy than men.

Two points for explaining a reason why women have a longer life expectancy than men.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following reasons why the female population age 80 and over is larger than the male age-80-and-over population:
The response correctly explains one of the following reasons why the female population age 80 and over is larger than the male age-80-and-over population:
The response correctly explains one of the following reasons why the female population age 80 and over is larger than the male age-80-and-over population:

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that the population pyramid does not provide any direct information about the types of push and pull factors in this location.

Two points for explaining how an additional type of data would be required to indicate the types of push and pull factors in this location.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following limitations of the population pyramid shown in illustrating the push and pull factors of migration in this location:
The response correctly explains one of the following limitations of the population pyramid shown in illustrating the push and pull factors of migration in this location:
